AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant stopped by border patrol agents on an interstate highway in Texas, owner of the truck, appellant in the current case, with a vehicle that had an apparent heavy load, occupants exhibited suspicious behavior when approached, vehicle was traveling at forty to forty-five miles per hour, contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, driver of the stopped vehicle, appellant arguing against the use of the Allen charge, seeking post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, defendant in a case where the trial judge denied a motion to interview jurors, stopped on an interstate highway in Texas 115 miles north of the Mexico/United States border, driver of a truck, truck owner with a vehicle having an apparent heavy or overloaded condition, driver of the truck, makes an assertion about the passengers' actions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, observed the vehicle and its occupants, leaned out of the window of the patrol car to observe the truck, did not testify to having reason to believe the vehicle came from the border, testified without contradiction about recent apprehensions of illegal alien smugglers, agent, testified that occupants were scrambling around trying to hide from his flashlight, shines a flashlight into the truck cab
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, observed the vehicle and its occupants, driving the agents' patrol car, did not testify to having reason to believe the vehicle came from the border, participated in the stop with knowledge of common smuggling routes, agent, testifies about the passengers' behavior
